metro.WindowControls

Class Window

  • java.lang.Object
    • metro.WindowControls.ActionObservable
      • metro.WindowControls.Window
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ControlElement

    public class Window
extends ActionObservable
implements ControlElement
    Creates a simple but fancy window with some extra functions like Control-management (managing buttons, labels, etc.).
    Author:
    hauke

    • Constructor Detail

      • Window

        public Window(java.lang.String title,
      java.awt.Point position,
      java.awt.Point size)
        Creates a new window.
        Parameters:
        title - The title of the Window, is shown in the top area.
        position - The position on the Screen (absolute)
        size - The size in pixel (absolute)

      • Window

        public Window(java.lang.String title,
      java.awt.Point position,
      java.awt.Point size,
      java.awt.Color color)
        Creates a new window.
        Parameters:
        title - The title of the Window, is shown in the top area.
        position - The position on the Screen (absolute)
        size - The size in pixel (absolute)
        color - The color of the border

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        public void draw(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.SpriteBatch g)
        Draws the window and all controls on it.
        Parameters:
        g - The graphic handle.

      • drawWindow

        private void drawWindow()
        Draws the background, border, head bar with title and the close cross.

      • update

        public void update()
        Updates everything. Is very important for e.g. drag-feature and Controls

      • addControlElement

        public void addControlElement(ControlElement cElement)
        Adds a new control to the window control list. If the new Control is already in the list, it won't be added again, so there are no doubles in this list.
        Parameters:
        cElement - The WindowControl element thta should be added.

      • isMouseOnWindow

        public boolean isMouseOnWindow(int screenX,
                      int screenY)
        Returns true is mouse is in window, false if not and also false if in window but on a control element.
        Parameters:
        screenX - x-coordinate of mouse
        screenY - y-coordinate of mouse
        Returns:
        boolean True/false if mouse is in plain window area without touching controls.

      • isMouseOnWindowArea

        public boolean isMouseOnWindowArea(int screenX,
                          int screenY)
        Checks if the mouse is in the window. This will NOT consider controls like the isMouseOnWindow(int, int) method does.
        Parameters:
        screenX - x-coordinate of mouse
        screenY - y-coordinate of mouse
        Returns:
        boolean True/false if mouse is in window.

      • mousePressed

        public void mousePressed(int screenX,
                int screenY,
                int mouseButton)
        Makes things when mouse is pressed.
        Parameters:
        screenX - The x-coordinate of the click
        screenY - The y-coordinate of the click
        mouseButton - The mouse button (using gdx.Input.Buttons)

      • mouseReleased

        public void mouseReleased()
        Makes things when mouse is released (important for drag-mode of the window).

      • mouseScrolled

        public void mouseScrolled(int amount)
        Description copied from interface: ControlElement
        Fires when users scrolls.
        Specified by:
        mouseScrolled in interface ControlElement
        Parameters:
        amount - Positive or negative amount of steps since last frame.

      • closeIfNeeded

        public boolean closeIfNeeded(int screenX,
                    int screenY,
                    int mouseButton)
        Closes the window if the mouse is on the cross. NO CLICK is needed in this function, be careful. This function calls the close() function to mark himself as closed.
        Parameters:
        screenX - The x-coordinate of the click.
        screenY - The y-coordinate of the click.
        mouseButton - The button that has been clicked.
        Returns:
        True if the window has been closed, false if not.

      • getPosition

        public java.awt.Point getPosition()
        Returns the position of the window.
        Specified by:
        getPosition in interface ControlElement
        Returns:
        Position.

      • close

        public void close()
        Marks this window as closed to let the METRO class know, that this instance/window can be removed.

      • isClosed

        public boolean isClosed()
        Returns true if window has been successfully removed from the window list.
        Returns:
        True - Already removed, False - Still exists

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

      • mouseClicked

        public boolean mouseClicked(int screenX,
                   int screenY,
                   int button)
        Description copied from interface: ControlElement
        Is called when mouse clicked with its left button.
        Specified by:
        mouseClicked in interface ControlElement
        Parameters:
        screenX - The x coordinate of the click.
        screenY - The y coordinate of the click.
        button - The button related to Buttons.xy.
        Returns:

        Description copied from interface: ControlElement
        Moves the element.
        Specified by:
        moveElement in interface ControlElement
        Parameters:
        offset - The amount of pixel to move. This is NOT the new position, only an offset!

      • getElements

        public java.util.ArrayList<ControlElement> getElements()
        Returns:
        A list of all controls attached to this window excluding itself.
